techniques.comment: Registered a phone app as an additional authentication factor in Entra ID (Update user),To circumvent MFA, the actor registered adversary-controlled devices with Azure AD/Microsoft Authenticator or Google Authenticator.

Registered the Afi Backup Entra ID app which lead to the creation of a service principal (corresponding Entra ID audit log event: Add service principal) and registered the Veeam backup application in Entra ID (corresponding Entra ID audit log event: Add application)
SCATTERED SPIDER has attempted to exfiltrate data to adversary-controlled GitHub repositories
In multiple cases, the adversary attempted to leverage access from initial victims to access cellular providers.
SCATTERED SPIDER used ADRecon to gather information about domain accounts, trusts, group policy objects, and permission groups.
SCATTERED SPIDER used ADRecon to gather information about domain accounts, trusts, group policy objects, and permission groups.
Attempted to update CloudTrail trail settings (UpdateTrail) and to delete flow logs (DeleteFlowLogs)
From victim SharePoint repositories, SCATTERED SPIDER gathered information on networking, MFA and remote access, and user onboarding.

SCATTERED SPIDER used ADRecon and ADExplorer to gather information about domain accounts, trusts, group policy objects, and permission groups.,SCATTERED SPIDER used ADRecon to gather information about domain accounts, trusts, group policy objects, and permission groups.
Some remote administration tools used by SCATTERED SPIDER used high TCP ports for C2 (4444, 5565, and 29381)

techniques.comment: SCATTERED SPIDER used AWS IMDS to gather information about IP addresses and subnets within the victim environment.
In one case, the adversary obtained a VPN-authentication certificate from a victim server. Separately, on AWS, the adversary used cat and grep to identify credentials in files on S3.
SCATTERED SPIDER used a Twingate connector as an internal proxy to obtain and maintain network access to private resources
SCATTERED SPIDER gathered data from S3 buckets; in a separate case, the adversary accessed corporate information on GSuite.
Created a new SSH key for an adversary-created EC2 instance (CreateKeyPair)

techniques.comment: Added AWS IAM access keys to pre-existing users (CreateAccessKey),Added credentials to Entra ID application registration (corresponding Entra ID audit log event: Update application – Certificates and secrets management ),SCATTERED SPIDER has created an access key for a pre-existing IAM user (CreateAccessKey) and attempted to create AWS login profile user password (UpdateLoginProfile)
Used command shell to run numerous system utilities

Attempted to deactivate GuardDuty (DeleteDetector) and CloudWatch alarms (DeleteAlarms),SCATTERED SPIDER often uses the publicly available script privacy-script.bat, which contains commands to disable Microsoft Defender functionality.

ESXi execInstalledOnly security control disabled.,To disable or uninstall EDR, SCATTERED SPIDER used regedit, batch scripts, or binaries to modify select registry values. After making these modifications, the adversary attempted to reboot victim machines in safe mode. The adversary also attempted to disable Duo enforcement via registry key modifications.
SCATTERED SPIDER typically attempted to authenticate using usernames and passwords, leading to generation of MFA push notifications to fatigue users
SCATTERED SPIDER exfiltrated some Jenkins-related files from AWS to transfer.sh and exfiltrated a file from a Docker container to bashupload[.]com.

On AWS, SCATTERED SPIDER deleted one user’s access key.,Reset the authentication factor to obtain access to the Entra ID account; access removal was not the primary objective,SCATTERED SPIDER often uses VMware PowerCLI to change root account passwords on ESXi hypervisors to complicate recovery.

On AWS, SCATTERED SPIDER deleted one user’s access key.
Likely exploitation of OpenAM vulnerability CVE-2021-35464

techniques.comment: In limited circumstances, the adversary used WinRM to run commands on remote services.
Mimikatz and MAGNET Ram Capture can harvest LSASS credentials.
SCATTERED SPIDER has installed the Cookie Quick Manager and EditThisCookie browser extensions to export session cookies
SCATTERED SPIDER opened Citrix configuration files using text editors such as Notepad++.
Used net to change several existing users’ passwords and modified UAC restrictions on certain passwords. On AWS, the adversary modified the existing role to escalate user privileges.

In one case, the adversary obtained a VPN-authentication certificate from a victim server. Separately, on AWS, the adversary used cat and grep to identify credentials in files on S3. To attempt to capture unsecured credentials, the adversary queried the AWS-instance metadata API at two different victims.,Retrieved credentials for Azure Storage (corresponding Azure activity log event: List Storage Account Keys); Almost certainly used MicroBurst to discover credentials accessible to Automation Accounts in Azure (corresponding Azure activity log event: Create or Update an Azure Automation Runbook)

SCATTERED SPIDER logs into Okta accounts across multiple victim companies almost certainly using the same device,SCATTERED SPIDER obtains valid credentials via smishing and uses these credentials to authenticate to VPN, Citrix or single sign-on portals. ,SCATTERED SPIDER primarily focused on capturing credentials and using these credentials to authenticate to VPN, Citrix or Okta portals.
Phishing pages captured credentials users willingly provided
SCATTERED SPIDER in some cases created additional domain accounts to enable persistent access

techniques.comment:
Actors can also leverage external-facing remotes services such as VPNs, to gain initial access and/or to maintain persistence in a victim network. This is often facilitated via pre-existing access to valid accounts, in which credentials are obtained via credential harvesting, brute forcing, or by obtaining credentials from other victims after compromising the network.

During the reporting period, SCATTERED SPIDER, VICE SPIDER, PUNK SPIDER, and ALPHA SPIDER frequently employed these techniques when targeting telecom entities.
Accessed several Entra ID accounts
On AWS, the adversary disabled one user’s MFA. Separately, the adversary attempted to disable MFA enforcement for several on-premises users.

Altered firewall rules on AWS to allow ingress from a specific AWS subnet,Altered firewall rules on AWS to allow ingress from a specific AWS subnet.

SCATTERED SPIDER often uses the publicly available script privacy-script.bat which contains commands to modify firewall settings
The adversary used mstsc.exe to establish RDP connections within victim environments.
The Kohgapy Python script is used to move tooling (ransomware binaries in particular) to target hosts

SCATTERED SPIDER uses PingCastle to query AD for computers:
PingCastle.exe --export computers --server [server] --user [user] --password [password]

SCATTERED SPIDER uses ADExplorer to gather user
and computer information from AD
SCATTERED SPIDER reboots Windows systems into safe mode using the command powershell.exe -WindowStyle Hidden -Command "bcdedit /set '{default}' safeboot network; shutdown /r"
SCATTERED SPIDER leverages email-forwarding rules for defense evasion, typically to prevent users from receiving suspicious account activity notifications or security alerts
Ran likely UAC-bypass binaries or disabled UAC restrictions by modifying accounts
Named newly provisioned VMs according to victim VM-naming scheme
Converted preexisting managed Entra ID domain to federated to add a federated identity provider (Set domain authentication)
Activated Cross-tenant access via Entra ID Cross-Tenant Synchronization,SCATTERED SPIDER added an additional actor-controlled identity provider to Okta and added a federated domain to Azure AD
SCATTERED SPIDER has attempted to send victim data from compromised email addresses to adversary-owned email addresses
Used schtasks.exe utility to run UAC-bypass binary
SCATTERED SPIDER used ScoutSuite and aws ssm describe-instance-information to discover information about AWS services running in the victim environment.
Called the helpdesk to reset the victim’s authentication factor,Employed voice phishing against the victim’s helpdesk to obtain access to an Entra ID identity

Captured accounts allowed the adversary to maintain access to most victim environments without malware. To maintain persistent access, the adversary continued to log in with valid credentials when possible.
To evade static AV scanning, the adversary used Pumpy to increase the size of binaries on disk.
,Downloaded data from AWS S3 buckets using S3 Browser

Actors can also leverage external-facing remotes services such as VPNs, to gain initial access and/or to maintain persistence in a victim network. This is often facilitated via pre-existing access to valid accounts, in which credentials are obtained via credential harvesting, brute forcing, or by obtaining credentials from other victims after compromising the network.

During the reporting period, SCATTERED SPIDER, VICE SPIDER, PUNK SPIDER, and ALPHA SPIDER frequently employed these techniques when targeting telecom entities.
Deployed AlphV ransomware to ESXi systems, Azure, and AWS VMs,SCATTERED SPIDER has used Qilin ransomware and ALPHA SPIDER's Alphv ransomware to encrypt data on both Windows and ESXi systems.
Began services on remote hosts using PSExec or RemCom

Azure VMs created for lateral movement,Created VMs in Azure (Create or Update Virtual Machine) and AWS (RunInstances),Provisioned new VMs within Azure to bypass VPN authentication while accessing on-premises network

The adversary heavily used ping to test connectivity to file-sharing sites and RMM tool-hosting sites.

Used PS to attempt to download various RMM tools and ran numerous PS scripts to gather information,Used PS to attempt to download various RMM tools and ran numerous PS scripts to gather information.

Uses the AADInternals PowerShell module to interact with Microsoft Entra ID.

Uses PowerShell to reboot Windows systems into safe mode: powershell.exe -WindowStyle Hidden -Command "bcdedit /set '{default}' safeboot network; shutdown /r"
The adversary used Advanced Port Scanner to enable internal reconnaissance.

techniques.comment: Deleted VPC firewall rules and added a new one that allowed egress traffic to all IP addresses (DeleteNetworkAclEntry, CreateNetworkAclEntry),Modified security groups (AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress) and AWS Firewall (DeleteNetworkAclEntry, CreateNetworkAclEntry, ReplaceNetworkAclEntry) to publicly expose an RDS instance
The adversary manually searches for and downloads victim data
The adversary attempted to capture data from internal customer/user databases, particularly CRM applications
SCATTERED SPIDER deployed a Twingate connector via Azure Containers

The adversary heavily used ping to test connectivity to file-sharing sites and RMM tool-hosting sites.,To employ System Network Configuration Discovery, a threat actor attempts to collect details about a network configuration and its settings. Multiple tools are available to help actors leverage this technique, including arp, ipconfig/ifconfig, ping, nltest, and route.

Threat actors commonly use multiple discovery techniques immediately following initial access and frequently employ additional discovery techniques during intrusions using LOLbins, including Security Software Discovery (T1018.001), Domain Trust Discovery (T1482) using nltest, System Information Discovery (T1082), System Owner/User Discovery (T1033), and Account Discovery (T1087).

SCATTERED SPIDER extensively uses the ping utility to test connectivity to various legitimate file- or RMM-hosting sites. In early 2023, the adversary accessed multiple North America-based technology companies that specialize in Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) and used the ping command to test connectivity to two different North America-based cellular providers.
Additionally, SCATTERED SPIDER used LOTL utilities, including ping and net, to discover information about network architecture and Active Directory (AD) information. SCATTERED SPIDER has employed this technique on both on-premise and Cloud environments.
